User Query: How does an OS handle deadlocks?
Generated Text: An OS handles deadlocks through various strategies: 1. Prevention by eliminating one of the necessary conditions. 2. Avoidance by dynamically analyzing resource allocation. 3. User Query: What is the difference between preemptive and non-preemptive scheduling?
Retrieval Keywords: preemptive scheduling, non-preemptive scheduling, CPU scheduling
Generated Text: Preemptive scheduling allows the OS to interrupt a running process to allocate the CPU to another process, whereas non-preemptive scheduling requires the process to relinquish the CPU voluntarily.

User Query: What is the role of a memory manager?
